Chuck-
Many years ago I sent Ken a deposit for a Blue Ram something. =C2=A0=
Honestly its been so long I can't remember but I believe it was going to be=
 a copy of the Blue Ram expansion, complete with keyboard and BASIC. =C2=A0=

The specs I honestly can't recall, and I'm to busy with finals to dig ever=
ything up. =C2=A0
Suffice it to say it was a long wait, some emails, more w=
aiting, some phone calls, more waiting etc. =C2=A0You get the idea. =C2=A0
=
In the end, it didn't work out, for whatever reason, Ken was not able to re=
plicate everything into a functioning unit, and again I don't remember what=
 the exact problem was or which component was the problem (I *think* it was=
 the Ram expansion part). =C2=A0
Ken was not out to take my money and run, =
he had another project on the back burner which did work out, he told me ab=
out it way before anyone else (as far as I know) and in the end I wound up =
with one of the first (if not THE first) Lil' White Rams. =C2=A0
It wasn't =
a Blue Ram replacement, but in the end I was happy with it since I'm really=
 just a gamer on the 'cade and was primarily interested in playing the game=
s that needed expanded memory. =C2=A0
So in the end I was just as happy. =
=C2=A0
If you haven't had contact with him lately, email him again, call hi=
m etc. =C2=A0He's a stand up guy as far as I'm concerned so I don't think y=
ou have anything to worry about.=C2=A0
As far as expecting this thing to be=
 delivered on time when it wasn't even a prototype yet, well, that probably=
 wasn't realistic. =C2=A0As someone who has spent years waiting for games (=
like Vectrex Warrior) and hardware (like the Atari 7800 XM) I can tell you =
that even with the best intentions things and people in the gaming communit=
y (and I'm sure others) don't always meet deadlines, or expectations. =C2=
=A0
Give the man a call, I'm sure he'll clear things up.=C2=A0
-Michael=C2=
=A0=C2=A0128Kgames.com=C2=A0128K. Your Life Will Never Be The Same.

      =
